content: Don’t use products that come with excessive packaging. One of the biggest culprits for creating paper waste is consumer packaging that’s used to wrap and label food, toys, clothes, and other goods. To help save paper, buy products that have been made with minimal or no packaging. Many of today’s consumer items are wrapped multiple times, such as a candy that comes in an individual wrapper, within a bag that’s also placed inside a box. Instead, look for packaging that has a sticker instead of a full box, for instance, or a tag instead of an entire container. Similarly, buy items that haven't been wrapped multiple times. Buying in bulk is a good way to reduce paper waste from packaging. Next time you or your family go shopping, make sure you take reusable bags, and buy what you can in bulk. Encourage your favorite companies to save paper. Unless consumers like you tell companies what you do and don’t like about their products and practices, they may not get the message. If it bothers you that certain companies waste too much paper, write them an email or call them to say you want them to join the fight to save the trees. To get a company’s contact information, check their website for a phone number or email address. For instance, if a company you like uses too much packaging and wastes paper, tell them you want to see more innovative and less wasteful packaging. Dine in instead of using takeout containers at restaurants. Another large contributor to paper waste is takeout food containers, which are often made of paper products or packed in paper bags. Next time you and your family decide to eat out for a meal, request that you sit down in the restaurant instead of taking the food in to-go containers. Most fast food restaurants use paper products to individually wrap all food, so ask your family if you can eat at a conventional sit-down restaurant for your next night out. Be selective about what you print. At home, at school, and at work, you can save paper by cutting down on the amount of material you print off. Before you print anything, ask yourself if you really need a paper copy, and only print something if you must. When you do need to print something off, reduce the font, increase the margins, and print on both sides of the paper so the project can be printed on fewer pieces of paper. [1] If teachers and employers require that you hand in paper copies of projects and assignments, ask if you can instead submit them electronically. Before you print off an assignment, letter, or personal project, proofread it on the computer so you don’t have to print off a second draft. Send, receive, and store electronic records instead of paper copies. Most documents these days can be shared and stored electronically, meaning you don’t have to print off paper copies for your records. For instance, if you need a copy of an electronic document, request that it be sent to you by email. For sensitive documents that shouldn’t be emailed, ask if you can save a copy directly to a flash drive. In the case where an original paper copy already exists and you need a record for your files, scan a version to your computer instead of making a photocopy. [2] When you need to provide copies of documents to friends, family, teachers, or people at work, ask if you can transmit files electronically using sharing services, email, or other electronic methods. Opt for paperless communications. Many companies and organizations offer electronic correspondences that can replace paper copies they traditionally send in the mail. [3] Whenever possible, sign up for paperless communications for items like: Bills Newsletters Monthly mailings Flyers and coupons Newspaper and magazine subscriptions Use electronic calendars and day timers. There are plenty of free calendars and schedulers available online that you can use to plan your days, keep track of dates and assignments, and schedule meetings and interviews. By using an electronic calendar, you can save the paper that would have been used on a calendar, organizer, journal, or other type of scheduler. Both Google and Apple provide free calendar products. There are also plenty of calendar apps that you can use on smartphones or tablets. Encourage others to save paper. In order to have an even bigger impact, you can also encourage friends, family, classmates, and coworkers to save paper as well. One of the best ways to reach the most people is to put up signs around the house, school, or office that inform people how they can help. There are lots of signs that you can print off from the internet that will help raise awareness about the importance of saving trees. The WWF has signs you can download and print. Make sure you print or draw your signs on reused paper (like the back of an old assignment). Trash containers and recycling bins are a great place for signs. Use reusable cloths instead of paper products. Around the house, a lot of paper is wasted every year on things like paper towels and napkins. And if you're using lots of paper products for cleaning, drying, and wiping your nose, you can save plenty of trees by switching to reusable versions. [4] To replace paper towels in the kitchen and bathroom, use tea towels to dry dishes, old rags to clean, and sponges to wipe up spills. To replace facial tissues, invest in a few handkerchiefs that can be washed and reused. To replace napkins at the dinner table, purchase cloth napkins instead, which can be washed and reused as well. Use real dinnerware instead of paper. Paper plates and dishes may be convenient, but they aren't good for the environment. Most paper plates just end up in the trash, meaning the paper isn't even recycled properly. When you have a party or any time the paper plates come out, ask to use the real dinnerware instead. If your family likes to go on picnics or camping trips, invest in reusable plastic dinnerware. You can get plates, bowls, cups, and utensils that are durable, unbreakable, reusable, and not made from paper. Use paper from other plant sources. There are times when it’s simply not possible to avoid paper-like products. Luckily, there are tree-free paper products available that are made from alternative plant sources, and many of these have a lower impact on the environment. Hemp is a versatile plant that grows much faster than a tree and produces more fiber. Hemp can be turned into fabric, writing paper, greeting cards, envelopes, and other paper products. Bamboo is another fast-growing species of plant that can be used for alternative paper products. You can find bamboo bathroom tissue, paper, towels, and even disposable dinnerware. Bring your own thermos or reusable mug to cafes. Disposable paper cups from cafes and restaurants are another way that lots of paper is wasted every year. Like paper plates, many paper cups end up in the trash, meaning they aren't properly recycled. Any time you go to a restaurant or cafe for a takeout drink, take a reusable coffee mug or thermos with you for coffee, hot chocolate, or other warm beverages. Use reusable grocery and lunch bags. Many grocery stores provide paper bags to pack groceries. You can help your family save paper by investing in reusable grocery bags. Similarly, if your lunches are normally packed in paper bags, ask about switching to a reusable lunch bag instead. If your family is hesitant about switching, ask them to consider how much money they spend on paper bags and grocery bags every year. Then, compare that to the one-time cost of reusable bags. Send e-cards. Lots of people like to send greeting cards for birthdays, holidays, and other events, and this leads to plenty of paper waste. Not only is the card itself paper, but it’s also sent in a paper envelope. Instead of sending paper greeting cards to all your friends and family in the mail, send electronic greeting cards for future celebrations. There are lots of e-card services out there that allow you to personalize designs, messages, and graphics to suit your taste and the type of celebration. E-cards are also great for sending out invitations to parties, weddings, and other events. Read e-books or library books. Books are great resources for school and work projects, and they're great to read as a leisure activity. But printed books are still made with paper, so you can save paper by using public versions of books that are available at the library, or by reading electronic copies instead. Buying used books is also a good idea, because you're reusing something that’s already been printed. Use computers instead of notebooks for school and work. School and work notebooks are a great way to keep track of things you're supposed to learn and projects you're working on, but you can save paper by keeping electronic notes instead. That way, you don’t have to rely on paper notebooks, and you can always have your notes saved to your computer. If you're in school, ask your teacher if it’s ok that you take notes on a computer or laptop instead of in a notebook. Buy recycled paper products. There are paper products available that are made with recycled paper, which means that no new trees were cut down to make those products. When you do need to buy paper products, look for things that were made with “post-consumer waste,” including: Bathroom tissues Printing paper Greeting cards Paper bags Use both sides of a piece of paper. When you do have to print or write things down on paper, make sure you get the most out of that paper by writing on both sides. If you currently only use one side of each piece, you can cut down on paper use by half just by using the other side too! [5] Writing or printing in a smaller size or font will also help you cut down on the amount of paper you need for notes and projects. When writing in notebooks, always fill the pages completely, and don’t start a fresh book until you’ve filled all the pages. Reuse gift bags, wrapping paper, newspaper, and tissue. Everybody loves a well-wrapped gift, but that doesn’t mean you have to use brand new wrapping paper for every gift you give. Instead, when you get a gift, keep the bag or wrapping paper it came in so that you can use it again for another gift. Newspaper can also be repurposed as an eco-friendly wrapping paper or tissue paper to stuff a gift bag. [6] Turn old paper products into crafts. There are plenty of crafts that require paper, so instead of using fresh sheets, why not reuse old paper that was already bound for the recycler. You can use old newspapers, notes, cards, and other paper to make things like: [7] Origami Wreaths Paper flowers Paper mâché Dolls Recycle paper you can't reuse. When you do have paper that you can't reuse or repurpose, make sure you recycle it instead of throwing it in the trash. Paper that goes in the garbage just ends up in a landfill. But paper that goes into the recycling bin can be sent to a special facility and turned into something new.

		<a class="sp_learn_more_link" href="/wikiHow:About-wikiHow#Why_should_you_choose_wikiHow_first.3F_sub">Learn more...</a>
</div>
</div>
<p>Trees are an important part of the planet’s ecosystem, they provide oxygen, clean the air, provide shade and food, and they're used as homes by many different creatures. To create paper and other wood products, millions of new trees must be planted each year. Even so, logging can be very destructive to the environment if it pollutes nearby water, leads to soil erosion, contributes to habitat loss, and uses a great deal of energy. To help reduce logging, there are many things you can do at home, school, and work to cut down on paper consumption.</p>

<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Cutting_Down_on_Paper_Products_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Cutting_Down_on_Paper_Products">Cutting Down on Paper Products</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-1.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-1.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/07/Save-Paper-Step-1.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-1.jpg" height="546" id="img_c8dd48dcf8" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c8dd48dcf8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/07/Save-Paper-Step-1.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-1.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Don’t use products that come with excessive packaging.</b> One of the biggest culprits for creating paper waste is consumer packaging that’s used to wrap and label food, toys, clothes, and other goods. To help save paper, buy products that have been made with minimal or no packaging.

<ul>
<li>Many of today’s consumer items are wrapped multiple times, such as a candy that comes in an individual wrapper, within a bag that’s also placed inside a box. Instead, look for packaging that has a sticker instead of a full box, for instance, or a tag instead of an entire container. Similarly, buy items that haven't been wrapped multiple times.</li>
<li>Buying in bulk is a good way to reduce paper waste from packaging. Next time you or your family go shopping, make sure you take reusable bags, and buy what you can in bulk.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Save-Paper-Step-2.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_407177c74b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_407177c74b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Save-Paper-Step-2.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Encourage your favorite companies to save paper.</b> Unless consumers like you tell companies what you do and don’t like about their products and practices, they may not get the message. If it bothers you that certain companies waste too much paper, write them an email or call them to say you want them to join the fight to save the trees.

<ul>
<li>To get a company’s contact information, check their website for a phone number or email address.</li>
<li>For instance, if a company you like uses too much packaging and wastes paper, tell them you want to see more innovative and less wasteful packaging.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-3.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-3.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Save-Paper-Step-3.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-3.jpg" height="546" id="img_d50bdde7a3" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d50bdde7a3')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Save-Paper-Step-3.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-3.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Dine in instead of using takeout containers at restaurants.</b> Another large contributor to paper waste is takeout food containers, which are often made of paper products or packed in paper bags. Next time you and your family decide to eat out for a meal, request that you sit down in the restaurant instead of taking the food in to-go containers.

<ul>
<li>Most fast food restaurants use paper products to individually wrap all food, so ask your family if you can eat at a conventional sit-down restaurant for your next night out.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-4.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-4.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Save-Paper-Step-4.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-4.jpg" height="546" id="img_748c59bf26" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_748c59bf26')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Save-Paper-Step-4.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-4.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Be selective about what you print.</b> At home, at school, and at work, you can save paper by cutting down on the amount of material you print off. Before you print anything, ask yourself if you really need a paper copy, and only print something if you must.

<ul>
<li>When you do need to print something off, reduce the font, increase the margins, and print on both sides of the paper so the project can be printed on fewer pieces of paper.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>If teachers and employers require that you hand in paper copies of projects and assignments, ask if you can instead submit them electronically.</li>
<li>Before you print off an assignment, letter, or personal project, proofread it on the computer so you don’t have to print off a second draft.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-5.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-5.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Save-Paper-Step-5.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-5.jpg" height="546" id="img_9d6ddb0831" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9d6ddb0831')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Save-Paper-Step-5.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-5.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Send, receive, and store electronic records instead of paper copies.</b> Most documents these days can be shared and stored electronically, meaning you don’t have to print off paper copies for your records. For instance, if you need a copy of an electronic document, request that it be sent to you by email.

<ul>
<li>For sensitive documents that shouldn’t be emailed, ask if you can save a copy directly to a flash drive.</li>
<li>In the case where an original paper copy already exists and you need a record for your files, scan a version to your computer instead of making a photocopy.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>When you need to provide copies of documents to friends, family, teachers, or people at work, ask if you can transmit files electronically using sharing services, email, or other electronic methods.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-6.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-6.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Save-Paper-Step-6.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-6.jpg" height="546" id="img_e583257029" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e583257029')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Save-Paper-Step-6.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-6.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Opt for paperless communications.</b> Many companies and organizations offer electronic correspondences that can replace paper copies they traditionally send in the mail.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup> Whenever possible, sign up for paperless communications for items like:

<ul>
<li>Bills</li>
<li>Newsletters</li>
<li>Monthly mailings</li>
<li>Flyers and coupons</li>
<li>Newspaper and magazine subscriptions</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-7-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-7-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Save-Paper-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_e7fa99f0b4" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e7fa99f0b4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Save-Paper-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use electronic calendars and day timers.</b> There are plenty of free calendars and schedulers available online that you can use to plan your days, keep track of dates and assignments, and schedule meetings and interviews. By using an electronic calendar, you can save the paper that would have been used on a calendar, organizer, journal, or other type of scheduler.

<ul>
<li>Both Google and Apple provide free calendar products.</li>
<li>There are also plenty of calendar apps that you can use on smartphones or tablets.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-8.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-8.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Save-Paper-Step-8.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-8.jpg" height="546" id="img_89c8181b8f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_89c8181b8f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Save-Paper-Step-8.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-8.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Encourage others to save paper.</b> In order to have an even bigger impact, you can also encourage friends, family, classmates, and coworkers to save paper as well. One of the best ways to reach the most people is to put up signs around the house, school, or office that inform people how they can help.

<ul>
<li>There are lots of signs that you can print off from the internet that will help raise awareness about the importance of saving trees. The WWF has signs you can download and print.</li>
<li>Make sure you print or draw your signs on reused paper (like the back of an old assignment).</li>
<li>Trash containers and recycling bins are a great place for signs.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Finding_Paper_Substitutes_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Finding_Paper_Substitutes">Finding Paper Substitutes</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Save-Paper-Step-9.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_a86106fd65" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a86106fd65')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Save-Paper-Step-9.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use reusable cloths instead of paper products.</b> Around the house, a lot of paper is wasted every year on things like paper towels and napkins. And if you're using lots of paper products for cleaning, drying, and wiping your nose, you can save plenty of trees by switching to reusable versions.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>To replace paper towels in the kitchen and bathroom, use tea towels to dry dishes, old rags to clean, and sponges to wipe up spills.</li>
<li>To replace facial tissues, invest in a few handkerchiefs that can be washed and reused.</li>
<li>To replace napkins at the dinner table, purchase cloth napkins instead, which can be washed and reused as well.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-10.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-10.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Save-Paper-Step-10.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-10.jpg" height="546" id="img_86ec81b123" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_86ec81b123')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Save-Paper-Step-10.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-10.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use real dinnerware instead of paper.</b> Paper plates and dishes may be convenient, but they aren't good for the environment. Most paper plates just end up in the trash, meaning the paper isn't even recycled properly. When you have a party or any time the paper plates come out, ask to use the real dinnerware instead.

<ul>
<li>If your family likes to go on picnics or camping trips, invest in reusable plastic dinnerware. You can get plates, bowls, cups, and utensils that are durable, unbreakable, reusable, and not made from paper.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-11.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-11.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Save-Paper-Step-11.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-11.jpg" height="546" id="img_53982c009e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_53982c009e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Save-Paper-Step-11.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-11.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use paper from other plant sources.</b> There are times when it’s simply not possible to avoid paper-like products. Luckily, there are tree-free paper products available that are made from alternative plant sources, and many of these have a lower impact on the environment.

<ul>
<li>Hemp is a versatile plant that grows much faster than a tree and produces more fiber. Hemp can be turned into fabric, writing paper, greeting cards, envelopes, and other paper products.</li>
<li>Bamboo is another fast-growing species of plant that can be used for alternative paper products. You can find bamboo bathroom tissue, paper, towels, and even disposable dinnerware.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Save-Paper-Step-12.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-12.jpg" height="546" id="img_1540b9c4b2" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_1540b9c4b2')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Save-Paper-Step-12.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Bring your own thermos or reusable mug to cafes.</b> Disposable paper cups from cafes and restaurants are another way that lots of paper is wasted every year. Like paper plates, many paper cups end up in the trash, meaning they aren't properly recycled.

<ul>
<li>Any time you go to a restaurant or cafe for a takeout drink, take a reusable coffee mug or thermos with you for coffee, hot chocolate, or other warm beverages.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Save-Paper-Step-13.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-13.jpg" height="546" id="img_b21c57f032" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b21c57f032')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Save-Paper-Step-13.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use reusable grocery and lunch bags.</b> Many grocery stores provide paper bags to pack groceries. You can help your family save paper by investing in reusable grocery bags. Similarly, if your lunches are normally packed in paper bags, ask about switching to a reusable lunch bag instead.

<ul>
<li>If your family is hesitant about switching, ask them to consider how much money they spend on paper bags and grocery bags every year. Then, compare that to the one-time cost of reusable bags.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Save-Paper-Step-14.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-14.jpg" height="546" id="img_4f91a883a0" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4f91a883a0')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Save-Paper-Step-14.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Send e-cards.</b> Lots of people like to send greeting cards for birthdays, holidays, and other events, and this leads to plenty of paper waste. Not only is the card itself paper, but it’s also sent in a paper envelope. Instead of sending paper greeting cards to all your friends and family in the mail, send electronic greeting cards for future celebrations.

<ul>
<li>There are lots of e-card services out there that allow you to personalize designs, messages, and graphics to suit your taste and the type of celebration.</li>
<li>E-cards are also great for sending out invitations to parties, weddings, and other events.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-15.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-15.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/07/Save-Paper-Step-15.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-15.jpg" height="546" id="img_cfd1487c3b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_cfd1487c3b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/07/Save-Paper-Step-15.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-15.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Read e-books or library books.</b> Books are great resources for school and work projects, and they're great to read as a leisure activity. But printed books are still made with paper, so you can save paper by using public versions of books that are available at the library, or by reading electronic copies instead.

<ul>
<li>Buying used books is also a good idea, because you're reusing something that’s already been printed.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-16.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-16.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Save-Paper-Step-16.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-16.jpg" height="546" id="img_7b0ef6733c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7b0ef6733c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Save-Paper-Step-16.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-16.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use computers instead of notebooks for school and work.</b> School and work notebooks are a great way to keep track of things you're supposed to learn and projects you're working on, but you can save paper by keeping electronic notes instead. That way, you don’t have to rely on paper notebooks, and you can always have your notes saved to your computer.

<ul>
<li>If you're in school, ask your teacher if it’s ok that you take notes on a computer or laptop instead of in a notebook.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Recycling_and_Reusing_Paper_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Recycling_and_Reusing_Paper">Recycling and Reusing Paper</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-17.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-17.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Save-Paper-Step-17.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-17.jpg" height="546" id="img_70eed7ee39" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_70eed7ee39')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Save-Paper-Step-17.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-17.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Buy recycled paper products.</b> There are paper products available that are made with recycled paper, which means that no new trees were cut down to make those products. When you do need to buy paper products, look for things that were made with “post-consumer waste,” including:

<ul>
<li>Bathroom tissues</li>
<li>Printing paper</li>
<li>Greeting cards</li>
<li>Paper bags</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-18.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-18.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/43/Save-Paper-Step-18.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-18.jpg" height="546" id="img_9535d35ffa" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9535d35ffa')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/43/Save-Paper-Step-18.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-18.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use both sides of a piece of paper.</b> When you do have to print or write things down on paper, make sure you get the most out of that paper by writing on both sides. If you currently only use one side of each piece, you can cut down on paper use by half just by using the other side too!<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Writing or printing in a smaller size or font will also help you cut down on the amount of paper you need for notes and projects.</li>
<li>When writing in notebooks, always fill the pages completely, and don’t start a fresh book until you’ve filled all the pages.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-19.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-19.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bb/Save-Paper-Step-19.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-19.jpg" height="546" id="img_17fde2ca5b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_17fde2ca5b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bb/Save-Paper-Step-19.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-19.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Reuse gift bags, wrapping paper, newspaper, and tissue.</b> Everybody loves a well-wrapped gift, but that doesn’t mean you have to use brand new wrapping paper for every gift you give. Instead, when you get a gift, keep the bag or wrapping paper it came in so that you can use it again for another gift.

<ul>
<li>Newspaper can also be repurposed as an eco-friendly wrapping paper or tissue paper to stuff a gift bag.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-20.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-20.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Save-Paper-Step-20.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-20.jpg" height="546" id="img_993eaf721b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_993eaf721b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Save-Paper-Step-20.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-20.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Turn old paper products into crafts.</b> There are plenty of crafts that require paper, so instead of using fresh sheets, why not reuse old paper that was already bound for the recycler. You can use old newspapers, notes, cards, and other paper to make things like:<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li><a href="/Make-Origami" title="Make Origami">Origami</a></li>
<li><a href="/Make-a-Paper-Wreath" title="Make a Paper Wreath">Wreaths</a></li>
<li><a href="/Make-Paper-Flowers" title="Make Paper Flowers">Paper flowers</a></li>
<li><a href="/Create-Papier-M%C3%A2ch%C3%A9" title="Create Papier Mâché">Paper mâché</a></li>
<li><a href="/Make-Paper-Dolls" title="Make Paper Dolls">Dolls</a></li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Save-Paper-Step-21.jpg?ajax=true&aid=691343" href="#/Image:Save-Paper-Step-21.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Save-Paper-Step-21.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-21.jpg" height="546" id="img_a76a74c88c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a76a74c88c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Save Paper Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Save-Paper-Step-21.jpg/aid691343-v4-728px-Save-Paper-Step-21.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Recycle paper you can't reuse.</b> When you do have paper that you can't reuse or repurpose, make sure you <a href="/Recycle" title="Recycle">recycle</a> it instead of throwing it in the trash. Paper that goes in the garbage just ends up in a landfill. But paper that goes into the recycling bin can be sent to a special facility and turned into something new.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Questions_and_Answers_sub"></a>
<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions" data-aid="691343" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">
<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="qa_headline">Community Q&A</span>
</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_aq_search_heading">Search</div>
<input class="qa_aq_search" placeholder="Type your query here"/>
</div>
<a id="qa_add_curated_question">Add New Question</a>
<ul class="qa_questions qa_aqs" id="qa_article_questions">
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="85547" data-caid="86420" data-cqid="85564" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="114619" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="6" data-votes_up="37">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Are there any other steps that would be helpful?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Don't waste paper if you don't need to. Making unimportant things such as paper airplanes, or writing one word on a piece of paper then throwing it out is wasteful.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>6</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>37</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="61819" data-caid="62692" data-cqid="61836" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="31403" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="9" data-votes_up="28">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How can I recycle gift wrappers?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">If the wrapper is mostly intact, you can cut it smaller, and reuse it to wrap other presents. You can also fold it into a <a href="/Make-a-Paper-Bag" title="Make a Paper Bag">paper gift bag</a>. Lastly, you can <a href="/Decoupage" title="Decoupage">decoupage</a> it onto wooden boxes or trays to make them look more colorful and interesting. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>9</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>28</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="162205" data-caid="163078" data-cqid="162222" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="928291" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="3" data-votes_up="12">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How can we spread the word about saving paper?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">There are many ways you can inform others about the importance of saving paper. For one, you can add an automatic signature to all your emails asking people to think twice about printing documents. You can also make sure that there are plenty of recycling bins around your school, workplace, or home, with signs explaining why it's so important to reduce, reuse, and recycle. Also, when you give gifts that have been made with or wrapped with recycled papers, add a little note explaining what you've done, and how the receiver can do the same. You can also encourage classmates and co-workers to be more mindful of their paper use. </div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>3</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>12</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="63232" data-caid="64105" data-cqid="63249" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="209643" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="12" data-votes_up="24">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How can I keep paper safe so that it doesn't tear?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">You could use a polyurethane sealer, which is available at any hardware store. This would create a thin-but-tough covering that's also waterproof. You could also try using a spray adhesive; the kind used in crafts.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>12</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>24</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="434173" data-caid="435046" data-cqid="434190" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2344079" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="4" data-votes_up="5">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How does plastic harm the environment?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">The manufacturing of plastic, as well as its destruction by incineration, pollutes air, land and water and exposes workers to toxic chemicals, including carcinogens. Synthetic plastic is not biodegradable. It just sits and accumulates in landfills or pollutes the environment.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>4</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>5</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

<div id="qa_submitted_question_form">
<input id="qa_asked_question" maxlength="200" placeholder="What do you need to know? We'll do our best to find the answer." type="text"/><div id="qa_asked_count">200 characters left</div>
<input id="qa_email" placeholder="Email address (optional)" type="text"/><div id="qa_email_prompt">Include your email address to get a message when this question is answered.</div>
<a class="button primary" id="qa_submit_button">Submit</a>
</div>
<!--  Template for rendering a submitted question -->
<script id="qa_submitted_question_item" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<li class="qa_sq" data-sqid="{{id}}">
	<div class="qa_divider"></div>
	<div class="qa_li_container">
		<div class="qa_bullet"></div>
		<div class="qa_sq_question">
			<div class="qa_q_txt">{{{text}}}</div>
			<div class="qa_editor_tools">
				<a class="qa_edit_submitted {{#qa_desktop}}button secondary{{/qa_desktop}}">{{qa_curate}}</a>
				{{^mobile_anon_user}}
				<a class="qa_flag_submitted" data-type="sq_flag">{{qa_flag}}</a>
				<a class="qa_ignore_submitted" data-type="sq_ignore">{{qa_ignore}}</a>
				{{/mobile_anon_user}}
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</li>

			</script><!--  Template for answer confirmation  --><script id="qa_answer_confirmation" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_answer_confirmation">

	<span class="x_button"></span>

	<div class="qa_answer_confirmation_response">
		<span class="qa_checkmark"></span>
		<div class="qa_social_login_heading standalone">{{qa_proposed_answer_confirmation}}</div>
	</div>

</div>


			</script><!--  Template form for creating/updating a curated question  --><script id="qa_question_edit_form" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_aq_edit_form">
	<div class="qa_aq_edit_form_status"></div>
	<textarea class="qa_cq_text" spellcheck="true" placeholder="{{qa_edit_form_question_placeholder}}">{{qa_edit_form_question}}</textarea>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_cq_text_error qap_char_limit">{{qa_cq_text_error}}</div>
	<textarea class="qa_ca_text" spellcheck="true" placeholder="{{qa_edit_form_answer_placeholder}}">{{qa_edit_form_answer}}</textarea>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_ca_text_error qap_char_limit">{{qa_ca_text_error}}</div>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_ca_text_error2 qap_char_limit">{{qa_ca_text_min}}</div>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_ca_text_error3 qap_char_limit">{{qa_ca_error_url}}</div>
	<div class="qa_invalid_msg qa_ca_text_error_phone qap_char_limit">{{qa_ca_error_phone}}</div>
	<input class="qa_pa_email" placeholder="{{qa_pa_email_placeholder}}"/>

	{{#qa_admin}}
		<span class="qa_edit_form_verifier_container">
			{{qa_edit_form_verifier_label}}
			<select class="qa_edit_form_verifier">
				{{#qa_edit_form_verifiers}}
					<option value="{{id}}" {{selected}}>{{name}}</option>
				{{/qa_edit_form_verifiers}}
			</select>
		</span>
		{{#qa_edit_form_show_remove_submitter}}
		<span class="qa_edit_form_remove_submitter_container">
			<label for="qa_aq_remove_submitter">{{qa_edit_form_remove_submitter}}</label> <input type="checkbox" id="qa_aq_remove_submitter" class="qa_checkbox" />
		</span>
		{{/qa_edit_form_show_remove_submitter}}
	{{/qa_admin}}

	<span class="qa_edit_form_inactive_container">
		<label for="qa_aq_inactive">{{qa_edit_form_inactive}}</label> <input type="checkbox" id="qa_aq_inactive" class="qa_checkbox" {{qa_edit_form_inactive_val}}>
	</span>

	<div class="clearall"></div>

	{{#qa_admin}}<a class="qa_aq_delete button primary">{{qa_edit_form_delete}}</a>{{/qa_admin}}
	<a class="qa_aq_submit button primary">{{qa_edit_form_submit}}</a>
	<span class="qa_spinner"></span>
	<a class="qa_aq_cancel button secondary">{{qa_edit_form_cancel}}</a>
</div>

			</script><!--  Template for the social login/signup form  --><script id="qa_social_login_form" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_social_login_form">

	<span class="x_button"></span>

	<div>
		<span class="qa_checkmark"></span>
		<div class="qa_social_login_heading">{{qa_thanks_for_answer}}</div>
	</div>

	<div style="clear: both;"></div>

	<div class="qa_social_login_body">{{qa_social_login_form_cta}}</div>

	<div class="qa_social_login_button_container">
		<div class="qa_button social_login_button facebook_button">
			<span class="social_login_button_icon"></span>
			<span class="social_login_button_text">Facebook</span>
		</div>
		<div class="qa_button social_login_button google_button">
			<span class="social_login_button_icon"></span>
			<span class="social_login_button_text">Google</span>
		</div>
	</div>

	<div class="qa_social_login_sub">{{qa_social_login_disclaimer}}</div>

</div>

			</script><!--  Template for social login/signup confirmation  --><script id="qa_social_login_confirmation" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_social_login_confirmation">

	<span class="x_button"></span>

	<div>
		<img src="{{avatarUrl}}" class="qa_social_login_avatar" alt="user avatar">
		<div class="qa_social_login_heading">{{qa_thanks_for_social_login}}</div>
	</div>

	<div style="clear: both;"></div>

	<div class="qa_social_login_body">{{qa_info_after_social_login}}</div>

	<a class="qa_social_login_done button primary">Done</a>

</div>


			</script><div data-type="" id="qa_flag_options">
<div class="hint_box">
<ul>
<li><a data-option="answered" href="#">Already answered</a></li>
<li><a data-option="not_question" href="#">Not a question</a></li>
<li><a data-option="bad_question" href="#">Bad question</a></li>
<li><a data-option="other" href="#">Other</a></li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<div data-type="" id="qa_answer_flag_options">
<div class="hint_box">
<ul></ul>
</div>
</div>
<!--  Template for rendering a desktop ArticleQuestion -->
<script id="qa_article_question_item" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
			<li class="qa_aq qa_block {{#inactive}}qa_inactive{{/inactive}}" data-aqid="{{id}}" data-cqid="{{curatedQuestion.id}}" data-caid="{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.id}}" data-sqid="{{curatedQuestion.submittedId}}" data-qa_inactive="{{inactive}}" data-votes_up="{{votesUp}}" data-votes_down="{{votesDown}}" data-verifier_id="{{verifierId}}" data-submitter_id="{{submitterUserId}}">
	<div class="qa_divider"></div>

	<div class="qa_li_container">
		<div class="qa_question_tab">{{qa_question_label}}</div>
		<div class="qa_q_txt{{#qa_desktop}} question{{/qa_desktop}}">{{{curatedQuestion.text}}}</div>
		{{#qa_staff}}<div class="qa_staff_info">{{staffInfo}}</div>{{/qa_staff}}

		{{#show_editor_tools}}
		<div class="qa_editor_tools">
			<a class="qa_edit_aq">{{qa_edit}}</a>
		</div>
		{{/show_editor_tools}}

		<div class="qa_answers">
			<div class="{{qa_answerer_class}}">
			{{#qa_desktop}}
				<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box">{{#verifierId}}{{> qa_expert_hover}}{{/verifierId}}</div>
			{{/qa_desktop}}

				<div class="qa_badge"></div>

			{{#verifierId}}
				<a href="{{#formatName}}{{verifierData.name}}{{/formatName}}" class="sp_namelink qa_person_circle" target="_blank" {{#verifierData.imagePath}}style="background-image: url({{verifierData.imagePath}})"{{/verifierData.imagePath}}>
					{{^verifierData.imagePath}}<span>{{verifierData.initials}}</span>{{/verifierData.imagePath}}</a>
			{{/verifierId}}

			{{^verifierId}}
				<div class="qa_person_circle" {{#submitterAvatar}}style="background-image:url({{{submitterAvatar}}})"{{/submitterAvatar}}></div>
			{{/verifierId}}

				<div class="qa_answerer_info">
				{{#verifierId}}
					<div class="qa_user_name">
						<a href="{{#formatName}}{{verifierData.name}}{{/formatName}}" target="_blank">{{verifierData.name}}</a>
					</div>
					<div class="qa_user_title">{{{verifierData.blurb}}}</div>
				{{/verifierId}}

				{{^verifierId}}
					<div class="qa_user_name">{{{submitterDisplayName}}}</div>
				{{/verifierId}}

					<div class="qa_user_label">{{qa_answerer_label}}</div>
					{{#isTopAnswerer}}{{^qa_desktop}}<div class="qa_ta_mobile_extra"></div>{{/qa_desktop}}{{/isTopAnswerer}}
				</div>
			</div>

		{{#qa_desktop}}
			<div class="qa_answer answer">{{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.text}}}</div>
			<div class="qa_answer_footer">
				{{> thumbs_qa_widget}}
				{{^qa_anon}}
				<a class="qa_ignore_answered" href="#">{{qa_flag_duplicate}}</a>
				<p class="qa_ignore_answered_thanks">Thanks!</p>
				{{/qa_anon}}
			</div>
		{{/qa_desktop}}
		{{^qa_desktop}}
		<ul>
			<li class="qa_answer">{{{curatedQuestion.curatedAnswer.text}}}</li>
		</ul>
		{{> thumbs_up_down}}
		{{/qa_desktop}}
		</div>
	</div>
</li>

		</script><!-- Template for rendering an unpatrolled QA --><!--  Template form for desktop thumbs up/down functionality  --><script id="qa_thumbs_qa_widget" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
	<span class='wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg'>{{thumbs_response}}</span>
	<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary">{{qa_thumbs_yes}}</a>
		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary">{{qa_thumbs_no}}</a>
	</div>
	<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box">{{qa_thumbs_nohelp}} <span>{{votesDown}}</span></a>
		<a href="#" class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box">{{qa_thumbs_help}} <span>{{votesUp}}</span></a>
	</div>
</div>



			</script><!--  Template for rendering a Top Answerers data --><script id="top_answerers_qa_widget" type="text/x-handlebars-template">
				<div class="qa_person_circle" {{#ta_image}}style="background-image:url({{{ta_image}}})"{{/ta_image}}></div>
<div class='qa_ta_name'>
	<span><a href="{{userLink}}" class="sp_namelink" target="_blank">{{userName}}</a>, {{ta_label}}</span><br />
	{{answersCount}} {{ta_answers_label}}
</div>
<div class="qa_ta_cats">
{{#topCats.0}}
	{{ta_subcats_intro}}
	{{#topCats}}<a href="{{cat_link}}">{{cat}}</a>, {{/topCats}}
	{{ta_subcats_outro}}
{{/topCats.0}}
</div>
			</script>
</div>
</div>

<div id="summary_wrapper"><div id="summary_text">
<h2>Article Summary<a href="#" id="summary_close">X</a>
</h2>
<p>To save paper, start by paying your bills online, storing records and documents digitally, and using electronic calendars instead of paper planners. You can also use a laptop instead of notebooks at school and work, reuse grocery and lunch bags, eat on regular dinnerware instead of paper plates, and bring your own thermos or reusable mug to cafes. When you do buy have to buy paper, go for recycled paper products and paper made from other sources, like hemp or bamboo. Finally, don't forget to recycle any paper trash that you generate! <span id="summary_last_sentence">For tips on repurposing used paper, read on!</span><span class="sumpos_bottom" id="summary_position"></span></p>

        "width": 1200,
        "height": 900
    },
    "author": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
        "@type": "Organization",

        "url": "https:\/\/www.wikihow.com",
        "logo": {

            "width": 326,

        },
        "sameAs": [

            "https:\/\/www.instagram.com\/wikihow\/",

            "https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/user\/WikiHow"
        ]
    },
    "aggregateRating": {

    },
    "datePublished": "2009-10-19",
    "dateModified": "2019-03-29",
    "publisher": {
        "@context": "http:\/\/schema.org",
